alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:47AM CDT until April 17 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... St. Croix River at Danbury affecting Burnett and Pine Counties. .Heavy rain on top of the existing snowpack will increase the rate of snowmelt. The resultant runoff will cause water levels in area rivers to increase and flooding is expected. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...St. Croix River at Danbury. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 AM CDT Saturday was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 6.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then rise to flood stage early Monday morning. It will fall for the remainder of the period. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 07/02/1958. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM CDT.
